defs: to drive or cause to move forward.
to come forward (usu. on one's own will).
to shoot (an arrow or a missile).
to urge to action; to stir up; to rouse; to incite.
to pursue in order to seize, kill, etc.; to chase.
to drive or expel by force.
to withdraw from advancing; to retreat.
to conquer and bring into subjection; to subdue.
to draw back (an arrow set on the string of a bow to shoot).
to come forth and spread around; to be diffused throughout.
to increase in volume or become larger as a result of pressure from within; to swell.
to push using force.
to move forward vehemently.
to be moved quickly and irregularly up and down, back and forth or from side to side; to vibrate; to shake.
to cause to grow or become more (in number, force, degree, etc.).
to become greater in size, amount, degree, etc.; to increase (oneself).
a man who attacks (as in a battle-field).
a kind of drum used in wars; a war-drum.
to rush toward vehemently with rancour, anger, etc.
to drive or expel by force.
to withdraw from advancing; to retreat.
to remove or prevent (an evil, danger, etc.).
to logically prove the fallacy of another's argument, view point etc.
to pay back one's debt (used in both literary and figurative senses).
to put out, extinguish (fire); to quench.
to advance forward unobstructedly or removing the obstacles.
to increase (something in number, quantity, degree, etc.).

a being spread over a wide area.
the front or top end of anything.
to cause to blow the chaff from (grain) by wind.
to push with force.
to throw or discharge with force.

to throw (something) as to scatter around.
to pay no attention to; to treat without due respect; to disregard.
to drive (a group of persons, animals, etc.) out in different directions.
to come out with a sudden rush or with force.
to avoid (an evil) happening or occurring; to prevent.
to move back and forth or from side to side frequently.
to discharge; to emit.
to push forward or away.
to run away (from a place).
to blow up or move with or as with an explosive; to explode; to blast.
to spend (money) wastefully or extravagantly.

to fall in drops over a wide area.
to allow or cause something to fall in drops.
a very minute space of time.
the uncomfortable or distressful feeling caused by a desire or need for water.
any of various plants of the grass family that are usu. used for food, fodder or grazing and as lawns.
(fig.) that which is worthless.
a thing of little or no worth; a worthless thing.
a kind of plant.
a little house of crudest kind with roof of straw; a thatched-roof house.

a clear, deep-blue variety of corundum, valued as a precious stone; sapphire.
the vine Cardiospermum halicacabum of Sapindaceae family; heart pea; balloon vine.
a kind of grass with long, and sharp blades.
any of various species of palm trees.
grain growing wild or without cultivation.
any of such grass plant.

2.any of a number of semitropical or tropical grasses (subfamily Bambusoideae) often resembling trees, with perennial, jointed stems that are woody, hard, springy, and often hollow and sometimes grow to a height of c. 36 m (c. 120 feet), stems of which are used in light construction and for furniture, canes, etc., and the young shoots of some species are eaten; bamboo plant.
a figure of a person in old clothes, stuffed with hay, set up to frighten crows or other birds away from crops; a scarecrow.
(fig.) a worthless man.
that which is as valueless as a straw.
that is worthless, valueless, hence useless.

a worthless man.
that which is as valueless as a straw.

the palm tree Cocus nucifera of the same family that bears coconuts; coconut palm.

any of the woody or tree like tropical and semitropical grasses of the genera Bambusa, Phyllostachys, Dendrocalamus, and allied genera, having woody, usually hollow stems with stalked blades and flowering only after years of growth; bamboo plant.
a tall grass, Saccharum officinarum of Poaceae family, having a stout, jointed stalk, and constituting the chief source of sugar; sugarcane.

any of various tropical and subtropical plants (genus Jasminum) of the Oleaceae family, with fragrant flowers; jasmine.
